text:
There comes a
time in a man's life

when he has to make
amends for all the things
he has done in the past.
Guess this is the place.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
See, life's a give and take.

And a man is not defined by what
he takes or how he gives back.
What's up, DiCaprio?
Is this Marquee Video?

- Yeah, this is Marquee Video.
- Yeah.

I found this cassette under
my bed from a while ago.

And I'm just trying to
return it because I'm
not the man that I once was.
OK, ID please.

- You need ID for returns?
- Yeah.

What is this, some
Patriot Act [MUTED]??
Or is just Trump on the rag?
[CHUCKLING]
Good one.
Go on back.
Look, man, I just don't--

I don't feel like
going back there.

I just want to return
this video, pay for it.

You need to go back
through that curtain.

And they'll take care of you.
- Thank you.
You have such a punchable face.
I actually am a model.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
What the [MUTED] is this?
Hey.
Hey.
Fun hair, man.
[MUMBLING]
(WHISPERING) Weirdos.

Guten tag, amigo.
What can I get you?
How you doing?

Look, man, I'm just trying
to return this videotape.

So this is going to sound
a little old fashioned,

but do you got like a drop
box or something that I could,

you know?
- No.

Actually, Marquee Video
closed a while ago,

but we still take
vintage VHS tapes
if you want to donate that.

Well, vintage--
I guess, well--

I guess this place
doesn't exist anymore.

But the label is
faded, so be careful.

I don't know what you're
going to be playing.
Don't worry about it.

We accept everything,
comedy, horror, rom com.
[MOANING]
Oh, damn.
That's ass.
Don't-- take it out.

Oh, I'm so-- ladies,
I'm sorry for the smut.

I'm not just walking
around with porn.

Why are there
only two of them?

Oh my god, is that
dude wearing protection?

Nobody watches that old
school mess anymore, son.

Haven't you seen all
these free videos online?
No, oh, hell.

I live in a halfway
house with dial up.
Dial up, you remember that, huh?

That means when my
niece graduated college,

I just downloaded her high
school graduation pictures.

I'm late.
- Well, you're in for a treat.
I'm in for a what?
[MOANING]
I love this one.
Oh, no.
Ain't that nice.
That's just disrespectful.

After 15 years in prison, I'm
even more motivated to get
myself together.

When I do that, that's
when I'm going to be proud.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

If you're going to live
here, you're going to work.

You need to start
your own restaurant.
Wow.

This is a metaphor for
exactly what you two are all

about, nice and
shiny on the outside,
dingy and empty on the inside.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
I'm in charge.
That's me.
[LAUGHTER]

Look at you looking
like a black geisha.
This is important to me.

I want my kids to look
at me with admiration.

A second chance is
a beautiful thing.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
[POLICE SIREN]

Put your hands on
the dashboard now.

A few bad apples
doesn't ruin the bunch.

That's coming
from a white dude.
All cops are not bad.

That's coming
from a black chick
that married a white dude.

And that's coming
from a black ex-crack
dealer who hates the police.
Touche.

That's coming from a person
who has a cousin named Touche.
[MUSIC PLAYING]

(SINGING) Back
in business, baby.

ANNOUNCER: "The Last OG," all
new Tuesdays at 10:30 on TBS.
